meanings.definition: Second person singular past tense of have.
meanings.sent1: You hadst a big smile yesterday.
meanings.sent2: She hadst a lovely garden in her backyard.
meanings.sent3: The cat hadst a secret stash of treats under the bed.
meanings.sent4: His heart hadst a melody that played on repeat.
meanings.sent5: The old house hadst a mysterious aura that lingered.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate possession or ownership in the past.
meanings.sent1: I hadst a shiny red bike when I was young.
meanings.sent2: They hadst a beautiful collection of antique books.
meanings.sent3: The pirate hadst a map to hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes hadst a sparkle of excitement.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact hadst a curse that haunted its owners.

meanings.definition: Used to indicate a past action or state.
meanings.sent1: He hadst a great time at the party last night.
meanings.sent2: We hadst a picnic by the lake on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The magician hadst a trick up his sleeve.
meanings.sent4: The old tree hadst a story to tell in its rings.
meanings.sent5: The town hadst a festival that brought everyone together.
